result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nikkita N. Green appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Nikkita N. Green. Defense stipulates to bond conditions in case 22CF356. Officer Eric Schoonover sworn in and testified by video. Witness identifies Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

04:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nikkita N. Green appeared in custody by video from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman not in court. Matter continued for Attorney to be present.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity:  initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:30 PM Defendant Nikkita N. Green in court in custody with attorney Colin T Nicholson.  attorney Nolah Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $25,000.00 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 3:00 PM.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim ZJ, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Curfew to be in residence from 6pm to 6 am unless at work or driving to or from work. Not to possess any weapons. No contact with Dakota Davidson, Damon Allen, Jaleel Weathers or Marcus Range. Court orders Level 3 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
